text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review the new step brothers
album Lorde stepping to old steppin tin
is a West Coast hip hop duo which
consists of seasoned MC and producer
evidence aka the weatherman you may know
this guy from the handful of solo LPS
he's put out over the years as well as
his work with groups like dilated
peoples and the alchemists a West Coast
producer DJ and MC who has a very long
running and successful track record has
worked with a ton of different artists
over the years from huge guys like
Eminem to smaller and newer dudes like
down-low Genesis and he's actually
worked with evidence already numerous
times in the past
providing instrumentals for his solo LPS
as well as various dilated peoples
tracks and with The Alchemist recently
doing these album length projects with
particular artists like damo Genesis and
Ono as gangrene and Action Bronson as
well as prodigy so it only makes sense
that he would go back into his past and
do something full-length style with
evidence assistants and when I heard of
who was gonna be on this project when I
heard the name of the project I was and
wasn't excited for for several different
reasons for one I haven't really loved
every project that Alchemist has put out
as of late with a single artist in mind
and evidence I can kind of take her
leave sometimes I'm familiar with his
earlier stuff and there are records in
his past that I enjoy but man does his
voice sound maybe just a little too
monotone after a while he's just got a
very very icy delivery however I do dig
some rock Marciano tracks occasionally I
did love that album that Cod just put
out last year so maybe there's something
to his delivery that will hit me this
time around and I'm glad I ended up
checking this thing out because the
first single to drop off this album step
masters awesome track there is a nasty
instrumental on this thing really grimy
bass rumbles chunky percussion horn
samples some really nice DJ cuts
everything is on point with this track
and I feel like alchemists production
just complements evidence so
much it's really the fire that
complements his so cold stairs the beat
on step masters and other tracks here to
just make them sound much more eerie and
and sort of menacing I think evidences
bars are really thoughtful a lot of the
time they are occasionally braggadocious
they references past and music however
lyrically and and delivery wise as well
alchemist is a lot less subtle he's more
aggressive he's more in-your-face as
he's delivering these bars that are
loaded with cartoony violence and sort
of exaggerated threats and much of the
time this dynamic does work it's kind of
like a bad cop
badder cop thing each MC has their own
distinct personality on this LP it's
really clear when one takes the reins of
a track and one doesn't but I do
occasionally feel like alchemist should
have done sort of a rewrite on some of
these lines the flow brings me more
dough than creamy krispies or change
your shitty drawers cuz your pants got
dumped in sometimes he's talking about
the crosshairs on his scope site or
saying he's gonna smack someone out of
their hoodie sure I just think there are
some rhymes on this LP that line up
awkwardly and don't really fit with the
gritty dramatic tone of the
instrumentals or alchemist super serious
delivery I mean when I pull lines out of
some of his verses and just read them
they sound like they would be more
fitting for a really kooky trap beat in
a riff raff song or something at least
then the comedy would have felt intended
and you know don't get me wrong
sometimes it does like I'm a big boy
don't give me no snacks animal head no
plate fresh off the axe and there are
numerous weird interstitial vocal
snippets in between these tracks that
bring songs together a little bit
there's sort of a weird narrative going
on at the end of one particular song
where this composer person hears sleigh
bells and is amazed by the sound and
then begins to travel the world
searching for different sleigh bell
sounds even though a lot of these songs
are tough talking there are plenty of
moments on this LP to sort of remind the
listener that what's going on here is
just sort of for fun I mean album's
title is
Lord stepping 10 and to me that does
sort of create another very small weak
link on this record though there are
some weak bars on here it's not that
distracting but another thing that does
underwhelmed me occasionally is the lack
of ambition on some of these songs like
on the song Byron g-good bars on this
track all around very good features as
well from hooligans and damo Genesis but
this instrumental sounds like a slightly
slower rehashed version of the Sylvester
Lungren beat that Alchemist gave to
Action Bronson for their collaborative
project together and the song tomorrow -
two good features from blue and raka
but another instrumentally underwhelming
track with all of these really dinky
synthesizers playing throughout the song
the track to me gets kind of redundant
and as 1mc trades places with another it
doesn't really feel like the beat is
showcasing or complimenting any one of
them whereas I think this track like
others on here such as swim-team Rastas
could have done a better job of throwing
these verses up on a pedestal Plus this
entire LP is bookended with two of the
weaker tracks
structurally weak I mean four won the
opener more wins it has a really smooth
tone I love the beat but it's not really
that much of a barn burning or
interesting start to the album it's
pretty short of breath and so is the
last track on here - just step which is
such a footnote of a song I'm surprised
it ends the album out I actually think
Lorde stepping to deliver Zitz most
unique hard-hitting and exciting tracks
right in the middle of the LP like with
the song legendary mesh which has this
trunk knocking beat really murky kind of
psychedelic bassline lots of guitar solo
samples and a plethora of sound effects
just dancing around in the mix playing
throughout the instrumental and I think
this song actually features one of
evidences best verses on the entire LP
and in his lyrics as well as the vocally
sampled hook on this track they're tons
of A Tribe Called Quest references and
the beats get even bigger than this one
like on swim-team Rastas a beat that
actually undergoes two instrumental
changes over the course of its runtime
and the song really changes moods every
single time the beat shifts and
lyrically I think this
one of the few moments on this LP where
Alchemist is actually on the same level
as evidence and is actually saying some
stuff that is not as overly blunt its
tracks like this that made me wish the
step brothers were this ambitious on
every single track here though there are
some songs that do impress me because
they have a lyrical concept sort of
running throughout them like see the
rich man play which has all these
references to casinos and gambling as
well as draw something this LP gets
super aggressive on one of the next
tracks here mums in the garage one of
the most hard-hitting instrumentals on
this entire LP and some of the most
aggressive verses as well there is a
feature from Action Bronson on this
track too but what surprises me even
more is the track banging sound which
has one of the most off-kilter rap
instrumentals that I am positively sure
you will hear all year I mean it's
mostly based off of this drum fill it
seems that is just not in a very fluid
groove but guys like evidence on this
track just ride the beat without
flinching even for a second I mean
listening to this instrumental I just
had the feeling that he's the sort of
guy that you know a grenade could go off
somewhere near him and he wouldn't even
flinch
and I love how noisy and layered the
instrumentation is on this b2 with the
chimes and the strings and all the vocal
harmonies too and for the most part I
love all the instrumentals and the the
lyrics that come along with the more
subtle tone down tracks - they have a
really strong moody vibe this LP does
offer quite a bit of instrumental
variety I think even if evidence and
alchemists start changing their flows or
their lyrical styles up too much on this
record though I don't really think they
need to I mean they've got a solid flows
they've got personality they've got
their sort of distinct voices my only
major complaint with this record is that
there were just a few tracks at the
beginning and at the end that I wasn't
that crazy about I actually loved a
great deal of the tracks on this thing
and could see myself returning to this
LP in the future I do think this record
is still kind of an acquired taste it
has very little in the way of pop appeal
but the beats are spectacular I feel
like they pair really well with the very
relaxed flows and I feel like overall
these guys couldn't have gotten a better
set of features
here - this thing is just a really great
